Title: Join our FREE webinar to discover what's shaping the building industry in 2024 & why it's a good time to build.
Content:
Everyone is well aware that the NZ building industry has been through a few interesting years. Coming out of Covid in 2021 saw a huge shift, mostly caused by the lowest mortgage rates ever seen in NZ and a building boom, followed by material prices increasing and product shortages. It was a turbulent time, but just as quickly as things turned tough, the good news is that the building industry is changing again.

Here at eHaus we are starting 2024 with confidence and zest following the recent release of new industry research and data, along with our own insights developed over the last 14 years of business.

Join our FREE webinar on Thursday 15 February from 7-8pm and discover why we believe it is a good time to embark on your building journey. In this engaging session, we'll delve into the factors shaping the building industry in 2024 and how eHaus is navigating the landscape this year. In the webinar we will explore:

✅ Prices for building materials and price certainty

✅ How annual housing consents are tracking and the impact on builders' capacity

✅ Predicted changes for inflation and mortgage rates

✅ Property values and the CoreLogic House Price Index

If you plan to build a new home, don‚Äôt be put off by the turbulence of 2020-2023. The market has changed, and we will guide you through how building in 2024 is possible.

There will also be a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to ask Jon any questions during the live event.

Don't miss this interactive opportunity to gain valuable insights into the building industry's dynamics in 2024.

When: 7-8pm, Thursday 15 February, 2024

Title: Breath of fresh air: Join our free webinar with Katheren Leitner to discover the impact indoor air quality has on our health
Content:
Respiratory conditions accounts for one in eleven of all hospital stays in New Zealand costing $6.7 billion every year and is the third leading cause of death. One in eight children and adults have asthma in New Zealand, with damp, cold and unhealthy housing conditions a key contributor to these statistics.

In May we celebrate World Air Quality Week and World Asthma Day. Both initiatives are designed to educate and raise awareness of air pollution, air quality and the risks to respiratory disease sufferers.

To continue that conversation, we will be hosting our next webinar with Katheren Leitner, Strategic Advisor and ex-Chief Executive at Asthma NZ, to discuss the importance of living in a healthy environment.

Join our free webinar on Thursday 9 May 2024 from 7-8pm where we will explore:

  • The impact indoor air quality has on our respiratory health
  • The problem with polluted air, moisture, and mould
  • How eHaus design and build with air quality and health in mind, reducing pollutants by 98% and removing moisture from inside homes

We will hear from Katheren on her learnings from her role of Chief Executive at Asthma NZ and the Healthy Homes A Kiwi Dream series.  

There will also be a Q&A session at the end. You can either submit your questions when you register or feel free to ask Jon and Katheren any questions during the live event.

Join us for what will be an interesting webinar!

Title: Why do homes overheat? Join our webinar to find out how we design & build to eliminate that risk
Content:
Are you concerned about new homes overheating? You're not alone. Recent media coverage and government updates to the H1 Building Code have highlighted these issues, but many of the proposed changes still miss the mark.

By November 2023, the final tranche of MBIE‚Äôs changes to the H1 Building Code were in effect. While these updates aimed to make homes more energy efficient, little thought was attributed to managing solar gain in the summer which created an over-heating problem. Ventilation was not adequately considered either, contributing to poor air quality and moisture damage.

At eHaus, we know the real problem isn‚Äôt too much insulation or high-performing windows‚Äîit‚Äôs a lack of understanding about how to design homes for year-round comfort.

In this webinar you will learn about the building science that makes it possible to design and build a comfortable, healthy home no matter where it is built in the country. We‚Äôll explore how:

  • Homes can maintain a comfortable temperature all year round.
  • Fresh, filtered air and no condensation are achievable with good design.
  • Energy modelling during the design stage ensures your home avoids overheating and moisture risks.

This approach allows us to predict the risk of overheating with a high degree of accuracy and eliminate any risk at the design stage.

We‚Äôll have a Q&A at the end, and you can submit your questions when you register or send them through during the event.
